Likes: colorful
vibrant
bright saturated colors
Dislikes: flat/gray haze or fog blankness that makes the image dull

Likes: cohesive color schemes
pink-purple-blue palettes (as blended gradients/accents, not half-and-half blocking)
Dislikes: hard left/right color split or diptych 'two halves' look

Likes: prismatic neon trails where colors interweave smoothly (no binary bands)
Dislikes: two-tone graphic ribbons/arcs that read like 'pink side vs blue side'

Likes: color variety beyond pink/blue (teal, emerald, coral, gold, warm lantern amber) while staying cohesive
symmetry/balance (arches, radial gardens, terraces) inside one unified scene
Dislikes: central seam/border/scar composition; 'two shores/two worlds' framing

Likes: gentle asymmetry + dynamic perspective (off-center focal, diagonal paths, S-curves) while staying readable
Dislikes: repeated poster layout: centered hero object + couple on centerline + one big arc/axis

Likes: outdoors/nature themes
calming gardens
secret garden vibes
water features (ocean/lake/pond/pool)
coastal/ocean scenery with a city backdrop (city secondary)
Dislikes: anonymous mid-rise blocks as main subject

Likes: Japanese city/garden aesthetics
Dislikes: greeting-card framing (wreath/garland border) or holiday decor overload

Likes: koi ponds
stylized cities as context (garden city / coastal town with nature)
future-glossy luminous buildings
fantastical architecture (inviting, functional, explorable)
fantasy elements (whimsical, safe)
uplifting, serene, joyful calm tone
bright daylight / golden hour / luminous optimistic lighting
clean, polished, well-maintained materials (polished stone, clean ceramic, glossy glass)
Dislikes: grit, weathering, concrete grain, cracks, patina

Likes: clear luminous water with sparkling reflections
storytelling with clear emotional read
mechanism-driven environmental metaphors (paths of light, water gates, atlas reshaping coast, gardens blooming)
one meaningful symbol only when diegetic (held/used/worn/used as a tool)
Dislikes: paired dominant symbols (two orbs/panels/frames) used to explain 'two worlds/options'

Likes: surrealism expressed through architecture/light/reflections (not clutter)
Dislikes: found-object collage / everyday object 'city' made of cups/coins/cables/etc.

Likes: no modern clutter props in-scene (unless explicitly requested)
Dislikes: phones / receipts / keys / random coins / staged everyday junk as foreground props

Likes: landmark + path + destination composition (lighthouse, aqueduct, bridge, observatory)
Dislikes: over-literal 'diagram' storytelling (multiple option-objects like three hero boats)

Likes: adventure/discovery/exploration vibes (boats/spaceships as travel/discovery)
Dislikes: sports/competition scenes that become rules-heavy spectacle with many actors

Likes: doable shared activities (hiking, walking garden paths, exploring terraces, boating)
Dislikes: too many simultaneous hero elements; 'too busy' cluttered scenes

Likes: environment-first framing (landscape as the star)
Dislikes: dominant foreground people who distract from the environment

Likes: people optional: tiny silhouettes or no people when the scene is about place
women/girls present (when people are included)
couple integrated naturally/organically in midground (not pasted)
Dislikes: couple pasted like a sticker / awkwardly slotted into a corner

Likes: if people are included: full-body visibility (feet/legs visible), natural poses
accurate anatomy (especially hands)
classic/timeless compositions
mildly impressionist / gouache / travel-poster / animated-film still look (clearly non-photoreal)
Dislikes: realistic photographic style / fashion-editorial / cinematic lens language

Likes: subtle holiday vibe via lighting/material warmth (1-2 motifs max)
wardrobe/styling as aesthetics (if fashion theme), no featured products
scene-first focus (environment + story), props always secondary
open, welcoming crossings/paths (inviting bridges, open gates)
gentle, joyful calm expressions/body language
cross-cultural romance shown as blended motifs within one shared place
Dislikes: literal 'two cultures = two cities/two shores' split-world metaphor

Likes: optional: non-human travelers (e.g., friendly aliens) when characters are needed for novelty
crisp sharp detail (when it suits the subject)
